articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinians displaced by fighting in the Gaza Strip crowded onto the seashore as Israeli forces continued to battle Hamas fighters in central and southern areas, with health officials reporting at least 17 people killed in strikes on Tuesday.
articles.title: Israel battles Hamas in Gaza as space for displaced families narrows

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby, Julie Steenhuysen
articles.description: Scientists studying the new mpox strain that has spread out of Democratic Republic of Congo say the virus is changing faster than expected and often in areas where experts lack the funding and equipment to properly track it.
articles.title: New mpox strain is changing fast; African scientists are ‘working blindly’ to respond

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched several waves of missile and drone attacks overnight targeting Kyiv and other regions, Ukraine's military said early on Tuesday, a day after Moscow's biggest such attack of the war.
articles.title: Russia pounds Ukraine with missiles, drones for second day in row, Kyiv says

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden's national security adviser Jake Sullivan is embarking on several days of talks with top Chinese officials in Beijing this week aimed at quieting tensions between the two superpowers ahead of the Nov. 5 U.S. election.
articles.title: Top US, China officials to meet on military, Taiwan, fentanyl

articles.author: Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: Telegram boss Pavel Durov could be held in police custody until Wednesday after French prosecutors said they had granted extra time for questioning, while a senior ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin alleged Washington was behind his arrest.
articles.title: Telegram boss to stay in French custody as Russia alleges US meddling

articles.author: Subrata Nag Choudhury
articles.description: Police in India fired teargas and water cannon to disperse hundreds of protesters marching in the eastern city of Kolkata on Tuesday to demand the resignation of a top state minister in the wake of a gruesome rape and murder of a trainee doctor.
articles.title: Indian police fire teargas at hundreds protesting over Kolkata doctor's rape, murder

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's Socialists and Greens will not participate in further talks with President Emmanuel Macron to find a way out of political deadlock, their leaders said on Tuesday, calling on their supporters to hold peaceful protests instead.
articles.title: France's Macron back to square one as left plans protests over political crisis

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg said senior officials in the Biden administration had pressured his social media company to censor COVID-19 content during the pandemic, adding that he would push back if this were to happen again.
articles.title: Zuckerberg says Biden administration pressured Meta to censor COVID-19 content

articles.author: Jessie Pang
articles.description: The first Hong Kong activist to defend himself in person in a landmark national security trial against 47 pro-democracy campaigners said on Tuesday he had no remorse over the alleged conspiracy.
articles.title: Activist in landmark Hong Kong security trial says he has no remorse

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said on Tuesday the relevant ministers will meet next week to discuss steps needed to secure local consent for restarting Tokyo Electric Power's Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear power plant.
articles.title: Japan PM Kishida to hold ministerial meeting on Tepco nuclear plant restart
